leadership.translation[0].definitions[0]: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc
The US must now take a firm leadership role.
The next leadership election is due in November.
the leadership of the Labour party
Our prospects of winning an election will be better under his leadership.
leadership.translation[0].definitions[1]: the quality of being good at leading a group, organization, country etc
She has great faith in her own leadership qualities.
leadership.translation[0].definitions[2]: all the people who lead a group, organization, country etc
The party leadership is in agreement.
In this meaning, leadership is usually followed by a singular verb
The leadership supports the change in the law
The leadership support the change in the law
leadership.translation[0].definitions[3]: the position of being in front of others in an activity or competition
Leadership in science is important to our nation.
leadership.translation[1].definitions[0]: the position of being the leader of a team, organization, country etc
The company did well under the leadership of its founder, Haruo Suzuki.
leadership.translation[1].definitions[1]: the qualities needed in order to be a good leader
a chairman with vision and leadership
leadership.translation[1].definitions[2]: the position of being the most important or most successful product, service or company of a particular type
US leadership in the aerospace industry
